result.execSummary:
The defendant Gillium Henry Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay stipulated restitution, joint and several, totaling $1,560.88 as follows: $1,200.00 to the BP gas station on 7532 West Center Street, Wauwatosa, Wisconsin; and $360.88 to Mobil Sunrise at 3870 SOuth Howell Avenue, Milwaukee, Wisconsin, from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance to be paid while on supervision. Restitution hearing 9-11-14.

Court ordered defendant to pay the DNA surcharge, plus costs and disbursements from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance to be paid while on supervision. Pay remaining balances of all counts. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.

****** Must be kept separate from co-defendant Jacques Johnson
***ORDER AMENDING JOC; Judge Dennis Moroney/dated December 1, 2014, defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the CIP program, NOT ELIGIBLE for WSAP***

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with the victims Ravi B., Gopal S., Lawrence D., Lisa S., Dana J., Elmogheera H., or Moshin M.
No contact with the BP gas station located at 1930 West Morgan Ave., Milwaukee; or the Citgo station at 6001 West Cleveland, Milwaukee; Lake Bluff Shell, 1425 North Farwell Avenue, Milwaukee; BP station at 641 North Hawley Road, Milwaukee, Wisoncsin; BP gas station at 7532 West Center Street, Wauwatosa, Wisconsin; or Mobil Sunrise, 3870 South Howell Avenue, Milwaukee, Wisconsin. 
No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with co-defendant Jacques Johnson.

Urine screens.
Parenting counseling/classes.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (31 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing August 21, 2014, received and filed.
/Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.  Copy sent to defendant and the District Attorney's Office.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis P. Moroney, Br. 20, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion to amend JOC.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for medical leave and release on electronic monitoring.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Gillium Henry Miller not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance.  State advised the court that it has received no additional restitution for today's hearing date from remaining victims.  Restitution remains as previously ordered with no additional amounts added on today's date.
List of read-in offenses submitted by the State, received and filed.
/(2), and Restitution Worksheets, filed.
/from Justice Point, received and filed.

Defendant Gillium Henry Miller in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of James W. Frisch for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carlson contacted the court and advised that she was ill and unable to appear.  The new date selected with her is August 21, 2014.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.
ADA Frisch notified via email; Attorney Carlson notified via telephone message.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.
/to the court in support of defendant dated 3/31/14, received and filed. rn

Defendant Gillium Henry Miller in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea hearing proceeds.   

AS TO COUNTS 4, 5 AND 6:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 4, 5 and 6 as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor, and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Parties request a presentence report.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Gillium Henry Miller in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
/from Justice Point, received and filed.  Defendant compliant. rn

Defendant Gillium Henry Miller in court with attorney Elizabeth Anne Carlson.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an additional scheduling date; additional discovery turned over.  Court granted joint request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/from Justice Point, received and filed.  Defendant compliant; copies provided to the State and defense counsel. rn

Defendant Gillium Henry Miller in court with attorney Elizabeth Anne Carlson.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant posted bail, so bail hearing withdrawn.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20 and all conditions of bail continue.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM013256  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-06-14

Attorney Elizabeth Anne Carlson in court, defendant Gillium Henry Miller not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery but has not received an offer from the State. Defense counsel requests bail hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 20.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gillium Henry Miller in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Gillium Henry Miller in custody.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RAVI B., BP STATION, 1930 W MORGAN; LAWRENCE D., LAKE BLUFF SHELL, 1425 N FARWELL; ELMOGHEERA H., BP STATION, 641 N HAWLEY RD.; GOPAL S., CITGO, 6001 W CLEVELAND; MOSHIN M, BP GAS, 7532 W CENTER, WAUWATOSA; AND LISA S., MOBIL SUNRISE, 3870 S HOWELL, MILWAUKEE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for ENHANCED SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gillium Henry Miller in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Gillium Henry Miller in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 12.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
